subject: Parenting
title: The Power of Acknowledgment
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Power of Acknowledgment.

hook.text: A child sets the table without being asked. You say 'I noticed you set the table.' She beams.

buildup.text: Acknowledgment is different from praise â€” it describes what you see without evaluating it.

discovery.text: Children respond powerfully to being seen. 'I see you shared your toy' is more motivating than 'good boy.'

twist.text: Acknowledgment avoids the dependency trap of praise â€” the child doesn't perform for your approval.

climax.text: It builds intrinsic motivation because the child connects her own action to the positive outcome.

punchline.text: Sometimes just being seen is the most powerful reward a child can receive.

quiz.question: How does acknowledgment differ from praise?
options: It describes what you see without evaluating it
